back in the early 2000s it struck down a

later it legalized gay marriage across

expanding an interpretation of gay
rights but that was a different court
and as you mentioned there were two new

Kennedy who was the author of those

cube folks that this would be a chance

particularly looking at justice justice
course such as you mentioned justice
Kavanagh coming on to the court that
ended up not being the case though
although Cavanaugh did vote with the

been a lot of heat around this is there
another side to the argument were there
some people who were trying to stop this
from happening and what reasons could
they give for trying to stop it well I
think you know because this was
essentially an argument over a reading

1964 a lot of prohibited employment

and what they were saying their
arguments was were that that these these

gay rights they weren't certainly
considering transgender rights when they
said you couldn't discriminate based on
sex and the idea of sex is something
that could be changed by an individual
over the course their lives that wasn't
something that these lawmakers
considered and if Congress wanted to

explicitly rather than waiting on the
court to interpret it itself
